Type.Name: WindowTypeHint

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WindowTypeHint extends System.Enum

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.remarks:
These are hints for the window manager that indicate what type of function the window has. The window manager can use this when determining decoration and behaviour of the window. The hint must be set before mapping the window.
These map to the FreeDesktop WM specification (http://freedesktop.org/Standards/wm-spec/)

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Combo = int32(12)
.field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Desktop = int32(7)

Docs.summary: Indicates a desktop feature. This can include a single window containing desktop icons with the same dimensions as the screen, allowing the desktop environment to have full control of the desktop, without the need for proxying root window clicks.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Dialog = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Dnd = int32(13)

Docs.summary: Indicates a drag and drop window type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Dock = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Indicates a dock or panel feature. Typically a Window Manager would keep such windows on top of all other windows.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint DropdownMenu = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Indicates a drop down menu window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Menu = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Window used to implement a menu.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Normal = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Notification = int32(11)
.field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint PopupMenu = int32(9)
.field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Splashscreen = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the window is a splash screen displayed as an application is starting up.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Toolbar = int32(3)
.field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Tooltip = int32(10)
.field public static literal valuetype Gdk.WindowTypeHint Utility = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Indicates a small persistent utility window, such as a palette or toolbox. It is distinct from type Toolbar because it does not correspond to a toolbar torn off from the main application. It's distinct from type Dialog because it isn't a transient dialog, the user will probably keep it open while they're working.
